availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James McClure Miller (Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Rachael Hitt Miller. Father of Mary Miller, John A. Miller, William Miller, Henry Bascum Miller, Mattie Miller, Charlotte Miller, Carrie Miller, and Raymond Miller. Farmer in Bourbon County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 558.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 116A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Millersburg, p. 32A-B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #6797.
"James McClure Miller (1823-1881)," Find A Grave, Memorial #217012961, accessed May 23, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/217012961.
